intro: Silene marschallii subsp. guicciardii, commonly known as the Guicciardii catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pinkish to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This subspecies is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
